subject: History
title: The Western Schism
description: Learn The Western Schism in one minute.

hook.text: For 39 years, the Catholic Church had two popesâ€”sometimes threeâ€”each calling the others frauds.

buildup.text: In 1378, Italian and French cardinals elected rival popes in Rome and Avignon. Both claimed authority.

discovery.text: European kingdoms chose sides based on politics, not theology. England backed Rome; France backed Avignon.

twist.text: A council tried to fix things by electing a third pope. Now there were three. The cure was worse.

climax.text: The Council of Constance finally resolved it in 1417, but the Church's moral authority was permanently damaged.

punchline.text: Three popes made people question the need for any.

quiz.question: How did the attempt to resolve the Western Schism initially backfire?
options: A council elected a third pope, creating three claimants
Both popes agreed to resign but then refused
The Holy Roman Emperor dissolved the Church entirely
